IT WORKED !! 720p to 1080 is day and night difference on Netflix. Video is so much detailed and crisp now.
**Check video resolution/bit rate using Ctrl+Alt+Shift+D
**Make sure Playback setting in settings of Netflix website is set to HIGH.

Only solution I found for getting 5.1 AC3 sound over SPDIF on Ubuntu. Works out of the box, excellent!

Before, I can only watch 480p due to netflix DRM (which I read in a forum post that limits video quality if not using their proprietary application, and is also explain by Louis Rossmann in his video). Now, I can watch 1080p quality in netflix. So, ty for the extension. simple yet working correctly. like buying a plug n play switch.

Before installing. Try watching a netflix videos and check the quality by pressing (CTRL + SHIFT + ALT + D) and look for "Playing bitrate". 

After that, install... Show more

This app is amazing but unfortunately, surround channels stopped working so only Left, Right, Center and Sub is working. It would be amazing to get an update for full 5.1 surround.
I didn't even know Netflix was cheating its customers out of a half decent resolution and always thought my monitor was just bad or uncalibrated. What an eye opener.

Great extension

This used to work perfectly. Still does for the picture quality part, but a few months ago Netflix made some change which now means that when you select 5.1 surround, it actually plays a LCRS mix derived from the stereo rather than the 5.1 stream, which is a great pity. Hope this is something that can be fixed.

It worked a few months ago but I tried it again recently and I'm not hearing the surround speakers.  I hear the center, sub, and main Left/Right, but not the rear surrounds in 5.1.  I'm certain my speakers are connected correctly.

And did I say it works on linux .. no more having to run netflix in a bloody windows 11 vm to get the high quality encodes.

Works great...BUT...what people need to realize is that not all of Netflix content is available with a max res of 1080p. Some of it is only 480p or 720p. If the content is available in 1080p, this plugin will let chrome play it (assuming your connection is fast enough).  What this extension won't do, is to magically make a 480p max video into a 1080p one.  If you want to verify a movie resolution, try it with MS Edge browser.  It doesn't hurt to read the instructions, either... :)
